SENT.plain: INTRODUCTION: Dural sinus thrombosis following minor head injury is rare
We report such a case in a child after mild head injury
CLINICAL PICTURE: A 4-year-old child presented with giddiness and vomiting after a fall
Magnetic resonance venogram revealed thrombosis of the right sigmoid and transverse sinuses
TREATMENT: The patient was managed conservatively
OUTCOME: Repeat scans 10 weeks after injury showed recanalisation of the thrombosis
CONCLUSION: Dural sinus thrombosis should be excluded in children presenting with persistent giddiness and vomiting after minor head injury
